edu.illinois.library.cantaloupe.image

Enum SourceFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<SourceFormat>
      • edu.illinois.library.cantaloupe.image.SourceFormat
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<SourceFormat>

    public enum SourceFormat
extends java.lang.Enum<SourceFormat>
    Contains constants for a wide variety of source formats, including all that any processor supports.

        public static SourceFormat[] values()

        for (SourceFormat c : SourceFormat.values())
    System.out.println(c);

      • getSourceFormat

        public static SourceFormat getSourceFormat(Identifier identifier)

        Attempts to infer a source format from the given identifier.

        (It is usually more reliable (but also perhaps more expensive) to get this information from a Resolver.)

        Parameters:
        identifier -
        Returns:
        The source format corresponding to the given identifier, assuming that its value will have a recognizable filename extension. If not, SourceFormat.UNKNOWN will be returned.

      • getSourceFormat

        public static SourceFormat getSourceFormat(MediaType mediaType)
        Parameters:
        mediaType - Media (MIME) type.
        Returns:
        The source format corresponding to the given media type, or SourceFormat.UNKNOWN if unknown.

      • isImage

        public boolean isImage()
        Convenience method.
        Returns:

      • isVideo

        public boolean isVideo()
        Convenience method.
